name: Exiled Faerie
description:
Faerie recusion with some event based econ backup.

The plan is to get in to anything, but only a few times. Hence Makers Eye rather than RDI and a few others...

Yes, not having plascrete has killed me, but I dont want to drop something to theme just to counter something that might come up.

name: DrippyWhizz
description: fun deck just wants to run amok

name: Infinite double advance
description:
Infinite frontiers with the eye on using shipments from sansan to FA

After the first play of the Frontier, I realised something interesting. Situational brilliant cards would be awesome with this ID.

So I made a bit of space for some freelancer and closed accounts. I am sure there are a few others that also deserve a slot. Maybe a cyberdex trial or similar. Minelayer is in because I want to create 2 ridiculously deep servers and ... no reason to not have ice in hand when you have 18 cards in hand.

The plan here is pretty standard. Protect R&D, maybe a single remote. Then get a Efficiency comity scored so you can FA anything out of hand using Shipments from SanSan and biotics if needed.

name: andromeda
WW1
description: It's my first attempt to a Weyland T&B, so please help me out because this thing is not very clear to me.

name: Weyland versatile
description: Some choices: Oversight AI to rez Hadrian's Wall or Archer. Fenris to punish facechecking. 1x Sea source seems OK, but you need to overadvance Project Atlas if you are going for the kill.Otherwise just score agendas behind a tower of ice. Ice on variable strengths to discourage Atman.

name: Can Noise mill competitively?
description:
Have any of you tried to build competitive milling deck, recently?

The one here is theoretical. I will give it a try and polish but would like to hear some potentially obvious suggestions first.

17 viruses. 6 of them can be recurred with Deja Vu.

Aesops for Daily Casts, Armitage and unneeded viruses.

The strategy would be to pull and install as many virus programs as possible while maintaining limited but constant pressure on different servers, starting with whatever comes to hand first: R&D with Medium; HQ with Nerve Agent, Account Siphon, Archives and remotes with Parasites and Datasuckers.

Wyldslde allows drawing cards like crazy. Cyberfeeder, Grimoire install and boost viruses for free, triggering thrash. Next turn Aesop frees up the memory for another install.

Levy resets stack mid game. Infiltration to make those few runs count.

Crypsis is there for cheap ice, Darwin for bigger ones. Imp for Jackson Howard, Interns and Archived Memory.

The typical turn would involve: 1 - Wyldside, 2 - Install virus, 3 - Play economy card/token on Crypsis. 4 - make run (probably every 2 turns).

What do you think?

name: Reina Wyldside/Joshua + Siphon
Chaos Stone
description: Experimental capstone deck. Played a different version at games night and it was not as bad as you might think. That version had 3 of all the breakers, magnum. Opus, toolbox, and personal workshop, basically a monstrosity. It felt like overkill, I think this might work better. I guess the essence is to draw a lot instead of tutoring which makes it easier to get both events and your breakers. Basically just get out pro con and churn through as fast as you can. The churn gets accelerated once the capstones come out and the Econ is supported by the events and Kati.

name: Huge Bioroids
description:
I need to find room for Cyberdex trials before a tournament.

Score large ice early with oversight. Scare off runs with Howlers. Stall with Ash and score with Biotic Labors or walls of ice.

name: Chess Darwin
description:
The problem with Whizzard/Whale decks has traditionally been the timing of the virus wipe. With the addition of Knight, Anarchs now have the ability to mitigate this quite a bit.

I've included two copies of mimic, in case of swordsman, or ice I can break cheaper with it, as well as Keyhole, rather than Medium.

name: Darwin Reina
description:
Darwin is really neat for Reina (whom I consider STRONGLY drawn to Rook and therefore the Caissa side of Anarch), since: - It actually makes Bishop useful. - Switching the full breaker suite for Darwin leaves MU for Keyhole and a single ICE denial tool (Parasite, Crescentus) at hand.

The single Emergency Shutdown is mostly a trick to scare the corp into properly defending the HQ (we want those sweet rez creds).and maybe working around a problem once in a while.

I'd really love to have some Deja Vu here, but there's only so much space.

name: Professor
